entry.string: By hooking search into bkview we enable the search results screen provide by the search module (GUI hook) and by hooking bkview into search module, we expose the bkview search function to the search module (API) hook
By clicking the checkbox these hooks will be enabled for you, so you dont have to do this manually

BK-view can use an XML http request for all links in the module. This means that only the module area is fetched from the server and dynamically replaced, and not the whole theme with it. If you have a site configuration which is suitable this can speed up the access to bkview considerably. This option works only with browsers which have support for the XMLHTTPRequest object (Opera has not, for example).

Setting this wont break the site if your clients browser does not support the xmlhttprequest object, it should gracefully fall back to a normal page request, so it's safe to set this to ON if you like.

You will have to have the module.xt page template (included in recent distributions) on the server, otherwise the speed increase is considerably less, because the whole page will be fetched regardless.

If you have page caching enabled, and bkview pages are normally cached, this option will defeat this. This needs to be fixed eventually. For now, if you have page caching, this option will still work, but the page wont be cached in the output cache. In your configuration, you'll have to test what is the optimal configuration.
Not really an issue, because it is by design, but worth mentioning is that this technique basically NEVER refreshes the page. This has two major consequences:

The back button (history functionality) will not be updated while navigating bkview.
UPDATE: An emulation for this has been implemented.
Dynamic blocks which base their content on the current page will keep their content as if still on the main page of the bkview module.
